result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse J. Jacobson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intentionally Mistreat Animals, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 951.02.
  • Intent. Fail/Provide Water for Animal, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 951.13(2).
  • Intentionally Abandon Animal, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 951.15.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

Must not take ownership of any domestic pets.

No consumption or possession of alcohol. No entry into any bars or taverns.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

timeConds.notes: To be completed within the first six months of probation.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jesse J. Jacobson in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 1:59 PM. State - plead to counts 1, 3 & 5 counts 2 & 4 would be DRI. Asking for 18 month probation with conditions of $500 fine plus costs on each count, AODA and follow through, no consumption/possession of alcohol, no entry into any bars or taverns, 100 hours community service, no ownership of any domestic pets, FT employment. Cirilli and Jacobson agree. Court DRI counts 2 & 4. Jacobson pleads NC to counts 1, 3 & 5. Court goes over PLQ with defendant and finds he is freely, voluntarily and intelligently entering his plea, waiving his constitutional rights and right to trial, court finds factual basis, accepts pleas and adjudges guilty. State makes final statement and asks court to follow joint recommendation. Cirilli makes final statement and asks court to follow joint recommendation. Jacobson makes statement. Court accepts joint recommendation and proceeds to sentencing: Counts 1, 3 & 5 - with hold sentence and place on probation for 18 months, fine of $500 plus costs on each count, AODA and follow through, no consumption or possession of alcohol, no entry into any bars or taverns, FT employment, 100 hours of community service to be completed within the first 6 months of probation, no ownership of any domestic pets. Appeal rights given, must submit DNA sample with expunction rights on DNA given.
Dwefendant's response to state's demand for discovery
Final pre-trial on July 11, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Jesse J. Jacobson in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:23 AM. Cirilli and Jacboson have complaint, waives reading of it, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas and sets for FPT. Court - bond - $250.00 cash that is already posted.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 11, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Due to DA no filing within 60 days.
Bonded out prior to probable cause.
